title: Katherine Jenkins looks effortlessly chic at the star-studded Global Gift Gala
text:
She is known for her elegant sense of style as well as her impressive singing skills.

And Katherine Jenkins looked effortlessly chic as she attended the annual Global Gift Gala held at the Kimpton Fitzroy London Hotel on Thursday night.

The opera singer, 39, showcased her toned figure in a strapless purple gown which had intricate detailing on the train and back.

Chic: Katherine Jenkins looked effortlessly chic as she attended the annual Global Gift Gala held at the Kimpton Fitzroy London Hotel on Thursday night

Katherine decided to forgo any necklace, letting her dress take centre stage, as she accessorised her look with a pair of pendant earrings.

The Welsh beauty styled her blonde locks into a luscious blow-dried hairdo and added a slick of make-up to enhance her stunning facial features.

Katherine looked radiant as she posed up a storm on the star-studded red carpet on Thursday night.

Proceeds from The Global Gift Gala go to The Global Gift Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organisation that aims to create a positive impact on the lives of children, women and families around the world.

Gorgeous: The Welsh beauty styled her blonde locks into a luscious blow-dried hairdo and added a slick of make-up to enhance her stunning facial features

The event, hosted by David Walliams, will see Simon Cowell handed the Philanthropist Award, while Paloma Faith – who will also perform – will receive the Empowerment Award.

Katherine's appearance comes after she recently discussed juggling motherhood with her work duties and detailed her strong connection to her late father.

She revealed she returned to work just weeks after giving birth to her son Xander to avoid 'letting people down' as she featured on the latest edition of Giovanna Fletcher’s Happy Mum Happy Baby podcast.

The mezzo-soprano singer, who is married to Andrew Levitas, also touched on her childhood and shared that she speaks to her late father Selwyn, who passed away from lung cancer when she was just 15 in 1995, in her 'vivid dreams'.

Strike a pose: Katherine looked radiant as she posed up a storm on the star-studded red carpet on Thursday night

Star-studded: The event, hosted by David Walliams, will see Simon Cowell handed the Philanthropist Award, while Paloma Faith – who will also perform – will receive the Empowerment Award

In June last year, the doting mother returned to work to perform Never Enough from The Greatest Showman at Classic Brit Awards at London's Royal Albert Hall, just a month after giving birth to her second child.

On bouncing back to work, the songstress, who also shares daughter Aaliyah, three, with husband of four years Andrew, explained: 'I did a smaller small when he was five weeks and a bigger one when he was seven weeks.

'The thing is its so hard, in classical music we book so far in advance so we actually book things 18 months ahead.

'Obviously you cant plan when you are going to get pregnant so I had to cancel quite a lot of international stuff in the time that I was not able to fly when I had him.

'After that point you sort of feel, now if I cancel these I could technically do them is there a way I can do them and get back into the bubble as quick as I can, I don’t like letting people down.'
